Ki...

The duplicate API request issue is caused by a race condition in the ask method of Task.ts
at lines ...
Multiple concurrent ask calls can occur during task executionEach ask call checks for queued message...
Multiple concurrent ask calls can occur during task execution...

Each ask call checks for queued messages using
isMessageQueued = !this.messageQueueService.isEmpty()...
Multiple ask calls can see the same queued message and process it simultaneously...
Each processing triggers submitUserMessage which creates new API requests...
Concurrent ask calls: Multiple parts of the system can call ask simultaneouslyNon-atomic queue check...
Concurrent ask calls: Multiple parts of the system can call ask simultaneously...
Non-atomic queue check: isEmpty() and dequeueMessage() are separate operations...
No synchronization: No locks or mutexes prevent concurrent access...
Timing-dependent: The race condition is timing-dependent and intermittent...
Tool execution completion: Tools call processQueuedMessages() which can trigger askMultiple tool exe...

Multiple tool executions: When multiple tools complete simultaneously...
Streaming completion: When streaming completes and triggers follow-up asks...
Error handling: Error recovery paths that trigger additional asks...

finishe...
Original finishSubTask method (/src/core/webview/ClineProvider.ts:466):...

Behavior: Only called completeSubtask() which added the subtask result to the parent's
conversation ...

Behavior: Now calls completeSubtask() AND then calls
recursivelyMakeClineRequests([], false)....

The race condition occurs because there are now two independent execution paths that can call
recurs...
Main task loop calls recursivelyMakeClineRequestsAPI call completesSubtask completion calls recursiv...
Subtask completion calls recursivelyMakeClineRequests...
Main task loop calls recursivelyMakeClineRequestsSimultaneously: Subtask completion calls recursivel...

Asynchronous Execution: Both calls are asynchronous and can interleaveNo Synchronization: There's no...
Asynchronous Execution: Both calls are asynchronous and can interleave...
No Synchronization: There's no mechanism to prevent concurrent calls...
Background Execution: The subtask completion call runs in the background...
Timing Dependency: The outcome depends on which call starts first...
The system can be in different states regarding recursive calls:...
IDLE: No recursive calls in progressRUNNING: One recursive call in progressCONCURRENT: Multiple recu...
CONCURRENT: Multiple recursive calls in progress (RACE CONDITION!)...
TRIPLE_CONCURRENT: 3 simultaneous calls (severe corruption)...

User starts orchestrator taskOrchestrator creates subtaskUser navigates away from chatUser returns a...
Subtask completes but orchestrator doesn't continue...
